get.description: Retrieves the server's conformance statement that defines how it supports resources and operations.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

get.description: It retrieves the history of all resources supported by the system.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of resources needed in a page.

parameters.name: _since
parameters.description: Specify an instant to only include resource versions that were created at or after the given instant in time. An instant in time is known at least to the second and always includes a time zone.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

200.description: A Bundle with type set to history containing the specified version history, sorted with oldest versions last, and including deleted resources.

get.description: Retrieves a summary of the profiles, tags, and security labels used by the system.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

200.description: Retrieves a summary of the profiles, tags, and security labels used by the system.

get.description: It generates a fully bundled document from composition.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

200.description: A fully bundled document from a composition.

get.description: It generates a document from a specific composition.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Composition. Sample ids are: 18077, 18078, 4850.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: MimeType of the binary content. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the Binary Data. Sample ids are: 2400, 5082, 4710.

parameters.name: _elements
parameters.description: Used to specify set of elements be returned as part of a resource. The _elements parameter consists of a comma separated list of base element names.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select binary data based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <=, < and != may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Use two _lastUpdated parameters to provide a range. The search parameter _lastUpdated can be used to select binary data resources based on the last time they were changed. The parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <=, < and != may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the profile element in the meta element of the binary data. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the tags element in the meta element of the binary data. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: This parameter searches on the security element in the meta element of the binary data. Value can have following formats: [code] or [namespace]|[code] or |[code].

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: The number of binary data resources that should be returned in a single page.

parameters.name: _summary
parameters.description: The _summary parameter requests the server to return only the elements marked as summary in their definition.

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular binary data, and any resources that it references. Parameter values for _include have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. binary data  2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _revinclude
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to fetch a particular binary data, and any resources that refer to it. It can have a value of one of the possible search parameters. Parameter values for _revinclude have 3 parts, separated by a : separator. 1. The name of the source resource from which the join comes i.e. binary data 2. The name of the search parameter which must be of type reference. 3.(Optional) A specific of type of target resource (for when the search parameter refers to multiple possible target types)

parameters.name: _sort
parameters.description: _sort is used to order the results in default(ascending) order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:asc
parameters.description: Used to order the results in ascending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

parameters.name: _sort:desc
parameters.description: _sort is used to order the results in descending order. The value can be one of the possible search parameters. The _sort parameter can repeat to indicate sort order, with the repeats indicating a lower sort priority sequentially.

200.description: Returns binary data such as such as images and other media, documents (CDA, PDF, Word etc.), plain text, XML.

get.description: Returns Binary resource having id given in path.

get.description: Returns the given version of the document as a sequence of bytes.

get.description: Translate a code from one value set to another, based on the existing value set and concept maps resources, and/or other additional knowledge available to the server.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code that is to be translated. If a code is provided, a system must be provided. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The system for the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the system, if one was provided in the source data.

parameters.name: valueSet
parameters.description: Identifies the value set used when the concept (system/code pair) was chosen. May be a logical id, or an absolute or relative location.

parameters.name: coding
parameters.description: A coding to translate. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: codeableConcept
parameters.description: A full codeableConcept to validate. The server can translate any of the coding values as it chooses. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Identifies the value set in which a translation is sought. May be a logical id, or an absolute or relative location.

parameters.name: dependency.element
parameters.description: A dependency is another element that may help produce the correct mapping. The element for this dependency.

parameters.name: dependency.concept
parameters.description: A dependency is another element that may help produce the correct mapping. The value for this dependency needs to be provided here.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

200.description: This operation returns a set of parameters including a 'result' for whether there is an acceptable match, and a list of possible matches.

get.description: Translate a code from one value set to another, based on the existing value set and concept maps resources.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the following format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The logical resource id associated with the ConceptMap. Sample ids are: 101, 102, v3-data-absent-reason.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The code that is to be translated. If a code is provided, a system must be provided. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The system for the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the system, if one was provided in the source data.

parameters.name: valueSet
parameters.description: Identifies the value set used when the concept (system/code pair) was chosen. May be a logical id, or an absolute or relative location.

parameters.name: coding
parameters.description: A coding to translate. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: codeableConcept
parameters.description: A full codeableConcept to validate. The server can translate any of the coding values as it chooses. Only one of the parameters (code, coding, codeableConcept) must be provided, to identify the code that is to be translated.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Identifies the value set in which a translation is sought. May be a logical id, or an absolute or relative location.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: dependency.concept
parameters.description: A dependency is another element that may help produce the correct mapping. The value for this dependency needs to be provided here.

200.description: This operation returns a set of parameters including a 'result' for whether there is an acceptable match, and a list of possible matches..
